alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 3:25PM CDT until July 30 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/. * At 424 PM EDT/324 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Georgetown to near Abbeville, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Bellville, Haleburg, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Wire Bridge, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Randolph Co A/p and Graball. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
